function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Underestimated modes of transmission","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impacted medical practice","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Possibility of vertical transmission of sars-cov-2 from mother to child","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limitations of included studies from specific geographic areas","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Viral shedding in feces and other body fluids despite resolution of symptoms","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of transmission through sharing of toilets","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Viral presence in body fluids such as saliva, urine, semen, and tears","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of virus through aerosols and droplets during surgical and dental procedures as well as from infected patients while talking, coughing, and sneezing.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Virus transmission through contaminated surfaces fomites and the viability of the virus in aerosols for up to 3 hours and on different surfaces for 4-72 hours.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential transmission of the virus through the gastrointestinal tract.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Possible modes of transmission of sars-cov-2 including airborne transmission via aerosols.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of covid-19 via fomites or surfaces","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Underestimation of modes of transmission","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential risk of cross-contamination from stainless steel surfaces due to inadequate cleaning procedures and disinfectant application.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"No in vitro data on efficacy of hand washing against coronavirus contamination on hands.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Compliance with hand hygiene is likely to remain an obstacle, especially among physicians.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Human coronaviruses can remain infectious on inanimate surfaces for up to 9 days.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertain viral load on inanimate surfaces","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Conflicting data on benzalkonium chloride efficacy against coronavirus at different concentrations and contact times.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Long persistence of coronaviruses on inanimate surfaces, up to 9 days at room temperature and 28 days at higher temperatures.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High transfer efficiency of viral load to hands from contaminated surfaces, with potential transfer to the face and mucous membranes.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Coronavirus persistence on surfaces and materials","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variation in coronavirus persistence based on temperature and humidity","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Effectiveness of biocidal agents in inactivating coronaviruses","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Person-to-person transmission of coronavirus in hospital and family settings.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contaminated dry surfaces serving as a potential source of coronavirus transmission.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient understanding of coronavirus persistence on inanimate surfaces.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of proper ventilation in green housing may lead to the propagation of contagious diseases.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor construction practices in prefabricated dwellings may lead to the accumulation of harmful microbes and contagions.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Fragmented research on the interaction between covid-19, housing policies, and green housing may lead to incomplete understanding of the components.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of micro-level building and macro-level city, country aspects of green housing during and after the covid-19 era may result in ineffective housing policies.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of emphasis on crisis-response measures, support for tenants and owners, and recovery strategies in housing policies may increase the risk of disease propagation and affect resident wellbeing.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of how buildings affect health in the context of a pandemic","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainties caused by the covid-19 pandemic leading to a lack of pragmatic instructions to reduce indoor risks","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Need for revision of building codes and certification processes to address specific pandemic-related needs","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases in the built environment due to inadequate building hygiene and wellbeing.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate indoor environment leading to poor air quality and health issues.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Human behavior and lifestyle affecting the spread of contagious diseases within the built environment.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of appropriate home environments for at-home work during covid-19","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate management of infrastructural and technical facilities","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient adaptation of facilities management in response to covid-19","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased risk of disease transmission in crowded living spaces due to pandemic restrictions.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate access to green spaces and outdoor environments in housing designs.","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited research on the relationship between green housing and covid-19","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Interactions between covid-19, housing policies, and resident behaviors influence green housing requirements","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited evidence on the impact of green housing in the context of covid-19 pandemic","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of comprehensive coverage of all affected countries in the literature review","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of investigation into the impact of housing policies on green housing and resident wellbeing during covid-19","category":"","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient analysis of the impact of green buildings, interest groups, and covid-19 on the built environment","category":"","confidence":"Medium"}]}
